title: Auth Cutover Runbook
description:
Explicit auth cutover strategy. Users must be able to log in seamlessly during and after migration.

Key considerations:
- OAuth tokens (GitHub, Discord) need re-linking flow
- Session tokens in flight during cutover
- OAuth-only users (never set password) need special handling
- Password reset email campaign timing
- Support playbook for locked-out users

title: Build OAuth provider re-linking flow (GitHub, Discord)
Implement session invalidation strategy for cutover
Build OAuth-only user detection and password set flow
Create password reset email campaign (timing: 48h before cutover)
Write support playbook for locked-out users
Build auth status dashboard (monitor login success rate)
Test cutover with 100 real users (beta group)
Data Integrity & Safety Infrastructure
description:
Critical infrastructure for safe migration: CDC mechanism, idempotency layer, reconciliation jobs, and drift detection. Must be complete BEFORE dual-write phase begins.

Key decisions:
- CDC: Application-level dual-write with idempotency keys + reconciliation (Option C)
- Redis Streams via Upstash for event log
- Daily reconciliation with Slack alerts on drift

title: Add stripe_event_id column to all mutation tables
Implement webhook deduplication check in process-stripe-webhook.ts
Add idempotency key generation for outbound Stripe API calls
Build daily reconciliation Inngest cron (PG vs PlanetScale checksums)
Build drift detection alerts (Slack notification on divergence)
Set up Redis Streams event log for migration events
Build rollback test: verify can flip back to Rails/Sidekiq
SEO Safety - Zero 404s Migration
description:
Protect organic traffic during migration. No 404s allowed. Staged rollout with monitoring.

Key URLs to preserve:
- /lessons/[slug] (5,132 lessons)
- /courses/[slug] (420 courses)
- /q/[...params] (massive sitemap from topic combinations)
- /i/[slug] -> /instructors/[slug] (134 instructors)

Monitoring: Google Search Console, 404 alerts, sitemap diff

title: Generate pre-migration sitemap snapshot (all URLs)
Build sitemap diff tool (compare pre/post migration)
Set up Google Search Console monitoring alerts
Build 404 monitoring with Slack alerts (immediate notification)
Implement staged rollout: lessons first (test 100 URLs)
Implement staged rollout: courses second (test 50 URLs)
Implement staged rollout: search pages last (/q/[[...all]])
Build comprehensive redirect map in next.config.ts
Kill egghead-rails and egghead-next
description: Migrate egghead.io (699K users, 420 courses, 3M progress records) from Rails + Next.js to Coursebuilder (PlanetScale/Inngest). Kill both legacy systems.

title: Schema design: Map Rails models to Coursebuilder

Stripe webhook handlers (Inngest)
Video player + lesson view + search
User profiles + instructor pages

Document Rails Stripe Webhook System for Next.js Migration
description: Comprehensive analysis and documentation of egghead-rails Stripe webhook implementation including controller flow, event model, multi-tenancy, error handling, and all event types to inform migration to egghead-next

title: Analyze StripeEventsController webhook flow and routing

Phase 0: Pre-Migration Safety + E2E Infrastructure
description:
**Migration Control Plane** - The infrastructure that orchestrates everything else.

## What This Phase Builds
- **Upstash Redis** - State store, event log, pub/sub, vector DB for codebase
- **Inngest Orchestrator** - Phase sequencing, task spawning, human checkpoints
- **Slack Bot** - Real-time notifications, approval buttons, escalation
- **Dashboard** - Live migration status, metrics, E2E results
- **Playwright Infrastructure** - E2E test framework with intelligent scheduling
- **Phase Contracts** - Explicit input/output requirements per phase

## Architecture
```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                 MIGRATION CONTROL PLANE                      │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  Upstash Redis ◄──► Inngest ◄──► Slack Bot                  │
│       │                │              │                      │
│       ▼                ▼              ▼                      │
│  [State + Events + Vector DB] [Orchestration] [Human Loop]  │
│                        │                                     │
│                        ▼                                     │
│              Agent Swarm (Sonnet 4)                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Gate Criteria
- [ ] Redis connected, vector DB indexed
- [ ] Inngest orchestrator deployed
- [ ] Slack bot responding
- [ ] Dashboard showing live state
- [ ] Baseline E2E tests passing
- [ ] Phase contracts defined for all 6 phases
- [ ] **[HUMAN]** Joel approves control plane before Phase 1

title: Set up Playwright E2E test infrastructure
Vector DB indexing - index all 3 codebases
description:
Use Upstash Vector to index the full codebases for agent context:
- egghead-rails (Ruby, ~50K LOC)
- egghead-next (TypeScript, ~100K LOC)  
- course-builder (TypeScript, ~200K LOC)
- Create embeddings for all source files
- Build semantic search API for agents to query
- Test retrieval quality with sample queries

title: Inngest orchestrator functions - phase sequencing, task spawning
description:
Build the Inngest orchestration layer:
- migrationOrchestrator function (phase sequencing)
- taskExecutor function (agent task execution)
- Human checkpoint wait/approval flow
- E2E validation triggers
- Retry logic with exponential backoff
- Event emission for all state transitions
- Integration with Redis state store

title: Slack bot - #egghead-migration channel, approval buttons
description:
Build Slack integration for human-in-the-loop:
- Create #egghead-migration channel
- Build Slack bot with Block Kit UI
- Phase start/complete notifications
- Human checkpoint approval buttons (Approve/Reject)
- Task failure alerts with error context
- E2E failure notifications
- Link to dashboard in all messages
- Inngest function to handle Slack events

title: Dashboard - live migration status, metrics, E2E results
description:
Build real-time migration dashboard:
- Phase progress visualization (7 phases)
- Task status per phase (pending/in_progress/completed/failed)
- Metrics display (users migrated, subs, progress records)
- E2E test results with failure details
- Event log timeline
- Human checkpoint status
- Redis-backed real-time updates
Location TBD: standalone app or part of egghead Coursebuilder app

title: Playwright infrastructure - E2E framework with intelligent scheduling
description:
Set up Playwright E2E testing infrastructure:
- playwright.config.ts for egghead Coursebuilder app
- Test fixtures and helpers
- Auth flow testing (login, logout, session)
- Content rendering tests (courses, lessons)
- Subscription/entitlement tests
- Intelligent scheduling (not after every task, batch at phase boundaries)
- CI integration for automated runs
- Screenshot/video capture on failure

title: Phase contracts - define input/output for all 6 phases
description:
Define explicit contracts for each migration phase:
- Phase 1: Data Migration (users, orgs, subs, content, progress)
- Phase 2: Webhook Handlers (Stripe Inngest functions)
- Phase 3: Cron Jobs (17 Sidekiq → Inngest)
- Phase 4: External Integrations (Customer.io, mailers)
- Phase 5: UI Components + E2E Click Matrix
- Phase 6: Cutover + Final Validation

Each contract includes:
- Required inputs (files, data, previous phase completion)
- Validators (DB connections, file existence)
- Output artifacts (files, reports)
- Metrics to capture
- E2E tests that must pass
- Human checkpoint criteria (if any)

title: Baseline E2E tests - validate current egghead.io state
description:
Create baseline E2E tests against current production:
- Homepage loads correctly
- Course pages render (sample 5 courses)
- Lesson pages render with video player
- Search works
- Auth flow (if testable)
- Instructor pages load
- Tag/topic pages load
These establish the "before" state for comparison after migration.

title: [HUMAN] Approve Migration Control Plane before Phase 1
description:
Human gate before starting data migration:
- [ ] Redis connected and state schema working
- [ ] Vector DB indexed with all 3 codebases
- [ ] Inngest orchestrator deployed and tested
- [ ] Slack bot responding in #egghead-migration
- [ ] Dashboard showing live state
- [ ] Baseline E2E tests passing
- [ ] Phase contracts reviewed and approved
- [ ] Joel signs off on control plane architecture

title: Create E2E click-test matrix document
Build baseline E2E tests for current state
Design CDC mechanism (ADR)
Build idempotency layer for migrations
Build reconciliation job infrastructure
Document and test rollback procedures
[HUMAN] Review and approve pre-migration safety plan
Upstash Redis setup - state store, event log, pub/sub
description:
Set up Upstash Redis for the Migration Control Plane:
- Create Upstash Redis instance
- Configure state store schema (MigrationState interface)
- Set up Redis Streams for event log (migration:events)
- Configure pub/sub channels for real-time notifications
- Create helper functions for state queries and updates
- Test connection from local dev and Vercel

title: Phase 6: Cutover + Final E2E Validation
description: Execute the cutover: dual-write webhooks, shadow mode (7+ days), flip primary, auth cutover, DNS switch. Each step has E2E validation and human checkpoints. Gate: 7 days stable post-DNS, final authorization to kill Rails. RAILS IS DEAD.

title: Deploy dual-write webhook configuration (Rails primary, CB shadow)
[HUMAN] Post-cutover monitoring + KILL RAILS authorization
Build shadow traffic comparison tool
E2E: Run full suite against shadow mode
[HUMAN] Shadow mode review (7+ days, <0.1% divergence)
Execute flip to Coursebuilder primary
Auth cutover + password reset campaign
description:
Auth cutover + password reset campaign

DETAILED RUNBOOK:

1. PRE-CUTOVER (T-7 days):
   - Identify OAuth-only users (no password set)
   - Send "set your password" email campaign
   - Test password reset flow end-to-end

2. PRE-CUTOVER (T-48 hours):
   - Send password reset reminder to all users
   - Notify support team of upcoming cutover
   - Prepare locked-out user support playbook

3. CUTOVER DAY:
   - Invalidate all Rails sessions
   - Switch auth to Coursebuilder NextAuth
   - Monitor login success rate dashboard
   - Support team on standby

4. POST-CUTOVER:
   - OAuth re-linking flow for GitHub/Discord
   - Handle locked-out user tickets
   - Monitor for auth-related errors

See epic migrate-egghead-04y for detailed subtasks.

title: E2E: Post-flip full regression suite
[HUMAN] DNS cutover authorization (24h+ stable)
Execute DNS cutover (keep Rails read-only 7 days)
Team Features (Not Deferred)
description:
Team features are NOT deferred. 266 teams with 1,619 seats represent significant revenue.

Minimum viable team features:
- Team dashboard (read members, see seats)
- Invite flow (send invite, accept invite)
- Seat management (add/remove members)
- Team billing (view invoices, manage subscription)

Defer to post-launch:
- Ownership transfer
- SAML SSO (~15 enterprise accounts)

Customer.io Integration
description:
Port Customer.io integration from Rails to Coursebuilder. Follow the pattern from ai-hero's email-list-provider.ts using the existing ConvertKit provider as template.

Events to track:
- subscribed (new subscription)
- billed (renewal payment)
- subscription removed (cancellation)

User attributes to sync:
- is_pro (boolean)
- Plan_Interval (month/year)
- subscription_status

Sanity Elimination - Single Database Migration
description:
Eliminate Sanity CMS dependency. All content moves to PlanetScale ContentResource tables. egghead becomes a SINGLE DATABASE application.

Current state: ~100 Sanity references in egghead app (lessons, courses, collaborators, software libraries)
Target state: All content in ContentResource with fields JSON

Note: 193 missing videos will redirect to /gone page (deprecated content)

Build ContentResource migration script for Sanity lessons
Build ContentResource migration script for Sanity courses
Migrate collaborators/instructors from Sanity to User table
Remove all Sanity write client usage (100+ references)
Update Inngest functions to write to ContentResource instead of Sanity
Build /gone page for deprecated content (193 missing videos)
Remove Sanity dependencies from package.json

Configure URL redirects (SEO critical) in next.config
description:
Configure URL redirects (SEO critical) in next.config

COMPREHENSIVE REDIRECT MAP:

```typescript
// Instructors (134)
/i/:slug -> /instructors/:slug (301)
/i/:slug/rss.xml -> /instructors/:slug/rss (301)

// Legacy content
/playlists/:slug -> /courses/:slug (301)
/s/:slug -> /courses/:slug (301)
/browse/:topic -> /q/:topic (301)

// User routes
/user -> /profile (301)
/user/:path* -> /profile/:path* (301)

// Deprecated content
/lessons/:slug (missing video) -> /gone (301)
```

MUST PRESERVE (no redirect needed):
- /lessons/:slug (5,132)
- /courses/:slug (420)
- /q/[...params] (massive sitemap)

See epic migrate-egghead-34t for SEO safety details.

title: E2E: Full click-test matrix (all critical user flows)
E2E: LLM agent exploratory testing
Essential Cron Jobs (Inngest)
description:
Port ESSENTIAL Sidekiq cron jobs to Inngest. Not all 17 - just the ones that break the site.

Essential jobs:
- StripeReconciler (daily) - catches webhook failures
- GiftExpirationWorker (daily) - gifts must expire
- RefreshSitemap (4h) - SEO critical
- SignInTokenCleaner (1min) - magic links pile up
- LessonPublishWorker (10min) - scheduled content

Skip for now:
- Report workers (daily/weekly/monthly) - nice to have
- Ranker workers - can rebuild later
- Podcast sync - low priority

Port LessonPublishWorker to Inngest cron (every 10min)
